intro: Eriodictyon californicum, commonly known as California yerba buena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats. Its leaves and flowers contain compounds that have been traditionally used by indigenous peoples for medicinal purposes. Eriodictyon californicum plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting local biodiversity.
